channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: High Street voucher scheme: Robin Swann to consider vaccination link
item.description: Robin Swann says he will look at only allowing those fully vaccinated to cash in high street vouchers.

item.title: Ballintoy: Man dies after incident at the harbour
item.description: The emergency services were called to the area on Monday night after a report of a person in the water.

item.title: Brexit: Sammy Wilson clashed with Edwin Poots over NI Protocol
item.description: In a letter, Sammy Wilson questions why the agriculture minister had not "resisted" officials' views.

item.title: Brexit: EU publishes proposals to simplify NI Protocol
item.description: The UK government says plans on the transport of medicines, food and animals do not go far enough.

item.title: Missing ring found by father-and-son detectorists at Downhill
item.description: Metal detectorists Andy and Ryan McCloy came to the rescue after a bride-to-be's social media appeal.

item.title: Irish Sea rescue after man spends 10 hours in water
item.description: The man is "stressed but stable" after his ordeal in the Irish Sea off the coast of County Louth.

item.title: Covid-19: Getting back on stage will 'feel like Christmas'
item.description: Two young actors cannot wait to perform live in front of an indoor audience on Tuesday.

item.title: Covid-19: Nurse says 'red tape' a delay to increasing staff
item.description: It follows a weekend when health trusts made urgent appeals for off-duty staff to return to work.

item.title: Former Irish senator Ian Marshall joins UUP
item.description: The Ulster Unionist Party says it is delighted to welcome Mr Marshall into the party.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Walsh wins as last-gasp try denies sevens quarter-final spot - NI day four at the Games
item.description: Belfast welterweight Aidan Walsh is into the quarter-finals but a last-gasp try costs Ireland's rugby sevens team a last-eight place on day four of the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Covid-19: Executive agrees on theatre and concert reopening
item.description: Theatres and concert venues can reopen while there are changes to how many people can meet indoors.

item.title: Covid-19: Hospital pressures mount as ICU numbers increase
item.description: The chief nursing officer says a surge in demand due to Covid has come more quickly than expected.

item.title: Belsonic and Custom House Square concerts ask for proof of Covid status
item.description: Belsonic and Custom House Square ask for proof of a negative test, vaccinations or antibodies.

item.title: Dr Michael Watt will not appear at neurological inquiry
item.description: An inquiry into governance issues around Dr Michael Watt has accepted he is unfit to give evidence.

item.title: Lisnaskea: Tully Forest fire had 'huge impact' on environment
item.description: NI Fire and Rescue says a fire in Tully Forest, near Lisnaskea, had a huge impact on local wildlife.

item.title: Covid-19: No more deaths and 639 new cases in NI
item.description: No more people have died within 28 days of testing positive for Covid-19 in Northern Ireland.

item.title: NI Covid-19 restrictions: Your questions answered
item.description: BBC News NI sets out the latest steps ministers are taking to ease Northern Ireland's lockdown.

item.title: Belfast and Dublin protests over Covid restrictions
item.description: Police say they will review footage of the Belfast protest and consider any legal breaches.

item.title: Covid-19: NI vaccine certificate app launches after interim scheme 'pressure'
item.description: The CovidCertNI app is now live as interim vaccine certification system users describe "a shambles".

item.title: Covid-19: Children with special educational needs 'forgotten' during pandemic
item.description: A report finds some families felt that Covid-19 was used as "an excuse" to limit or stop services.

item.title: Covid-19: Belfast Trust to cancel some surgeries
item.description: The trust says the decision will relieve some of the pressure on its bed and staffing issues.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Ballywatticock: What is the origin of NI weather station names?
item.description: Ballywatticock had its moment in the sun but what is its origin that of other weather station names?

item.title: Omagh ruling: Victims' families and politicians react
item.description: Victims' families and politicians respond to the judgement in case linked to Omagh bomb.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Japanese artists reimagine countries as anime samurai
item.description: The creators have used the flags of competing nations as inspiration to design Japanese warriors.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ireland's women's hockey team's journey to their first Games
item.description: BBC Sport NI looks into the journey of the Ireland women's hockey team ahead of their first Olympic Games

item.title: Shark spotting and dolphins diving off the coastline
item.description: Many creatures of the sea have been popping up in recent times in waters off the island of Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish pubs and restaurants serving indoors again
item.description: Irish pubs and restaurants resume indoor service after the lifting of Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: From lockdown animations to Snoop Dogg music video
item.description: After his homemade animations went viral, Snoop Dogg asked Peter Quinn to direct his new video.

item.title: Badger cull considered in attempt to tackle bovine TB
item.description: Bovine TB costs the taxpayer up to £40m a year and plans to cull badgers are being put to the public.

item.title: New exhibition explores life along Derry-Donegal border
item.description: The production, entitled Borderlands, will feature interviews from 22 people living in border areas.

item.title: Axa Insurance: Company announces 60 new jobs for Londonderry
item.description: The new jobs will take the firm's workforce in the north west to more than 600.

item.title: Arlene Arkinson 'let down by criminal justice system'
item.description: An ex-detective who took over the inquiry says police should apologise for searching a family home.

item.title: Nanotechnology: Seagate-led NI consortium wins £42m grant
item.description: The grant will allow firms to develop new technology for medical devices, communication and storage.

item.title: Ronan Keating accepts phone hacking damages
item.description: The ex-Boyzone singer's lawyers told the High Court of the distress caused by newspapers stories.

item.title: Coronavirus: Irish pubs and restaurants resume indoor service
item.description: Many pubs, especially those that don't serve food, have been closed since March 2020.

item.title: Coronavirus: Draft guidelines for Irish indoor hospitality published
item.description: From Monday, businesses must ask customers for proof that they have immunity from Covid-19.

item.title: Shots fired at police patrol car in Dublin
item.description: Gardaí are investigating the incident which happened in Tallaght at about 02:30 local time on Saturday.

item.title: Extreme heat: Ireland records two tropical nights in a row
item.description: It is the first time temperatures fell no lower than 20C on the island of Ireland two nights in a row.

item.title: Lough Sheelin: Teenager pulled from water dies in hospital
item.description: The teenager was the fifth person to die in lakes on the island of Ireland in the last week.
